website_summaries.verdict: Entry-level combo trailer and stroller that works well in both modes but lacks a little durability. Smooth ride for a low price point.
pros: Low price offering from an established brand
Easy setup, solid frame, good ventilation and smooth ride
cons: Questionable durability due to plastic components
Cramped for two, and rear storage impinges on kid compartment

customer_reviews.title: LITERAL Life Saver!
customer_reviews.text: My two children (4yo & 2yo)and I were hit yesterday in a crosswalk by a car turning at about 10-15 mph who failed to yield the right of way. This steel frame on this trailer took all of the damage and was light enough to be pushed aside from the car. My kids came out of the accident nearly unscathed it was miraculous! A few bruises on both and a bump on my 4 yo head but ultimately they're alive and well thanks to the design of the instep trailer! Thank you and I definitely hope to get another soon!
customer_reviews.author: Angel T.

customer_reviews.title: We were enjoying it very much. But after one ...
customer_reviews.text: We were enjoying it very much. But after one year the plastic on the wheel just broke down. Picture included
customer_reviews.author: DP&SB

customer_reviews.title: Wheels
customer_reviews.text: I got rid of those pneumatic rear tires. The rims cracked and leaks developed. I put wheel chair wheels on the back, the only modification was to put new bearings in the wheels. Tows behind my bicycle and hand push without issue.
customer_reviews.author: Nevada Rover

customer_reviews.title: SO GLAD I BIUGHT THIS
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I got this! I was undecided whether to get a seat for the bike or the cart. Ran into someone that had this same cart & she sang its praises. My daughter is 14mos & enjoys sitting in the middle, sipping on her cup & liking around. I can also use this as a stroller if needed. 100% satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Sally

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Had this for two weeks and has worked great! Easy to buckle child and a smooth ride. We also are able to fit so many other things in it too without causing my kid to be too squished!( like a small grill and stuff for the beach-not even kidding!) We live in an area with a lot of bumps and holes in the roads, and this goes over them all easily and without any problems! Also, on the plus, it is bright orange, which is great for safety and visibility!My husband cannot stop raving about it- and he is the one who has it hooked to his bike so that is a plus!
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha H

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for smaller kids
customer_reviews.text: This fits two kids, but unless they are both smaller kids, it’s not perfect. We got this for my 6 month old and my 3 almost 4 year old and it’s a little squishy with both of them in it. It works in a pinch for longer rides, but it’s better for my toddler to ride their own bike. But it was really easy to assemble. It’s so easy to switch from trailer mode to stroller mode, I love the space in back to out extra things and it’s been a great purchase to pull my baby around in when we got for bike rides.
customer_reviews.author: Kaz

customer_reviews.title: Bad Tires
customer_reviews.text: After 17 miles (after 5 uses), the tires gave up. I emailed the company and they gave me new tire and waited for 2 weeks then after one day of use, the tire is flat again. I want to like this product because I can go out with my son 3x a week but the tires gave up easily.
customer_reviews.author: Tinny

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly nice for the price
customer_reviews.text: The passenger compartment is smaller than a comparable name-brand trailer, both in length and height, such that my 4.5 year old can not fit very comfortably (she fits fine in a Chariot). My only other complaint is that one of the tires was installed backwards on its wheel (they're directional for water/rain). But it's surprisingly well made for the price. I mean, it costs an eighth of what a Chariot costs, and does the job 85% as well. That's a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Zipperer

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy not good quality!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in June 2019 and the straps on the inside child harness and the straps holding the enclosure to the frame have snapped and disintegrated. I now have a big pile of $125-135 plus tax trash that lasted 2 rides in a span of 9 MO. I am very upset and have never bought anything this low in craftsmanship and frankly it's longevity scares me a bit since I put my 2 year old in it. when I tried to put him in it for the first clear day after winter he bust right out of the straps. So much for safety!
customer_reviews.author: Wolfpack

customer_reviews.title: Many weaknesses but the tires are the biggest.
customer_reviews.text: Poorly manufactured. I always treated it well and kept the tires inflated to their stated psi. After around 10 uses the plastic rim itself busted. I never hit a curb or mistreated it, it's just a bad product and you don't even get your money's worth with this one. The other rim has a weird deformity to it as well.
customer_reviews.author: Gravy Robber

customer_reviews.title: Great fun and easy to hook up to any bike.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had one like these for my now 15 year old and my niece when’s they were kiddos not much older than my now 2 year old so I know they’re worth the price and fun. They are super easy to put together and attach to either a quick release axle or a bolted one like my husbands bike. She loves riding in it better than a stroll on the stroller considering how hot it is here in TN. A fast paced ride keeps her cool enough to last +7 miles. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: sonogirl2001

customer_reviews.title: Wheels are trash
customer_reviews.text: Great until... the back tire popped off. I thought the tire had lost some of its bottom pieces, so I ordered new tube and tire. I put the exact amount of air psi suggested on tire, and once again popped off. I think it’s the actual wheel/rim. It’s plastic and cheap and very expensive to buy a new one because they are almost nowhere to be found. Stick with a trailer that has metal rims. The picture shows that I had the new tube and tire and it didn’t work. It had been now on this wall for the last 6 months useless...
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Will last a few rides
customer_reviews.text: This item would be perfect if came with better tires. We got a flat on its virgin ride. However, the company sent free replacements. I replaced the wheels and used about 10 times. My kids love it and I have hard time getting them out of it. At any rate, the plastic wheels are already damages from bumps on the road. It’s a pretty good idea to buy and see if your kids like it. But, I would expect it to last forever. In fact, we’re not going to use it anymore. Another thing, my kids weigh 60lbs combined and the hammock style seating places my kids bottoms too close to the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Thrift Life

customer_reviews.title: I should have done more research on this one.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this about 2 years ago. For the $120 we spent on it, it's junk. The seat is flimsy even when tightened. The handle when you use it as a stroller is too low even in the highest possible placement. We've used it less than 20 times and the tires leak already. Also, you literally have to take it apart to fold it up for storage. Completely impractical. I should have done more research on this one. Don't waste your money on this disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Fast and easy
customer_reviews.text: Great buggy. I have only used it a few times, so more about set up and use vs. longevity. Right out of the box, pops open. That's pretty much it. Took about 2 minutes to set up. Kiddos love it, and rides smoothly. It is a little heavy on uphills but I assume that is the case for all of these buggys, not just this one. Good price, good set up, good use so far. Can't speak to the long term quality but as of now highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DANGEROUS product
customer_reviews.text: We casually used this once our kids were old enough to use it, and the plastic wheel rim is clearly defective. My local bike store saw the crack (in the pictures) that caused the tires to blow out, and thankfully they did it at a slow speed, and the wheel didn't fail while going on a trail or something like that. I would not recommend this to anyone! Hopefully the manufacturer fixes this in coming models.
customer_reviews.author: rayinchicago

customer_reviews.title: This trailer is perfect to cart our 1 and 3 year olds around ...
customer_reviews.text: This trailer is perfect to cart our 1 and 3 year olds around behind the bike! There is plenty of storage space in the back to store food, water, and toys and there is plenty of room in the seat area for both kids to have toys and books during the ride. So far the longest we...and by we I mean my husband...have ridden with them in the back is about 15 miles but plan on riding 28 in the next few weeks. The kids seem pretty happy and comfortable enough to take a nap and they don't seem to be bounced around.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah B

customer_reviews.title: This has been wonderful for biking to the park and around our neighborhood
customer_reviews.text: Bought the double for my son who is at the top of the charts for height and weight. This has been wonderful for biking to the park and around our neighborhood! Haven't used the stroller piece because it is quite wide and I have a good stroller for car traveling places. He sits in the middle and it does sink down a little from his weight, he is no where near touching the ground. The Velcro could use some stronger sewing along the front for where the cover attaches to the frame, I will have to re-attach it in the near future after 2 summers of use.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: My 2 and 3 years old both fit in there and they love it
customer_reviews.text: My toddlers refuse to leave the trailer once they are in it They seem very comfortable , it got pockets on each side for them to hide there small toys for the ride, very easy to attach to the baike and assemble , easy to maneuver , roomy, exceeded my expectations in the built quality, and the price was a steal compared to other options in the market We use it once a week , attached to the bike , and im extremly happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: AYMEN3M

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Don’t buy if you don’t have enough room to keep it set up
customer_reviews.text: This is really well made. My only issue with it (which I should have thought through before buying it) is that I don’t have a big enough storage place for it to always be set up so every time we come back from a ride/run we have to take the time to unfold it all the way.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Stucki

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together, breaks down small, lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I am a nanny and absolutely love this. I work with kids ages 2.5, 3, and 4.5 and all of them loved it! I also put my French bulldog in it because she loves biking with me but get tired quickly. I don’t really notice it when I’m biking. It’s a great construction so I don’t fear it would ever become detached. It’s super lightweight and easy to get in to my car.
customer_reviews.author: Coco

customer_reviews.title: I like how you can have two kids seated here
customer_reviews.text: This arrived yesterday and my son and I got to test drive it attached to my GT Legato 1.0 road bike. Installation was straight forward and quite simple. I like how you can have two kids seated here. Even better that there is a middle buckle to give a single child a better seat. I wish there was more seat padding for the little ones.
customer_reviews.author: M. Altamirano

customer_reviews.title: Was easy to assemble, looks good and solidly constructed. Happy.
customer_reviews.text: Was easy enough to assemble. For my bike, (Schwinn Discover Men's Hybrid Bike 700C Wheels) the one hiccup in fitting the coupler onto the rear axle was the allen bolt that held my rear fender in place. It was too close and the coupler was too wide. The workaround is to remove the fender's support bar from the hole that's meant for it's bolt and reuse the rear carrier's bolt for both the carrier and the fender. This is kinda stupid since Schwinn and instep are supposed to be collaborators. Even otherwise, a top selling trailer not fitting the top selling bicycle easily is not ideal. Luckily, the workaround was not too hard. Here's the result.
customer_reviews.author: Roshan Ram Rammohan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to attach and light weight
customer_reviews.text: We used this alot over the summer. Easy to attach and light weight. It fits my 5 year old and 2 year old comfortably. Has 2 sets of buckles for double riding or you can put one kid in the middle. It also has a little basket on the back for storage!
customer_reviews.author: Nichole

customer_reviews.title: Awesome buy
customer_reviews.text: I love this bike trailer/stroller. I've been looking for a stroller that was also a trailer for a while now and finally found this one in my price range. It can be a little difficult to fold up compared to other strollers where it fold by the click of a button. I'm not the biggest fan that the front wheel sticks out when you just want to use the stroller but hey it works and my kids loved taking a ride in it behind the bike.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Kueker

customer_reviews.title: Such an easy to assemble trailer!
customer_reviews.text: We go this trailer for our twins' first birthday. It was very easy to put together and install on my bike. It is sturdy, smooth, and convenient! I especially like the extra room behind the seats for storage. The stroller wheel fits there easily with a diaper bag, jackets, water bottles, and anything else you can think of.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Bumbach

customer_reviews.title: The Green Machine
customer_reviews.text: Wife loves this trailer. She uses it for the grandkids 2 and 6 years old to pick them up from school. She says that it is so much easier to push than the baby stroller and does not have to struggle with it. I think it may be attributed to the large wheels. There is plenty of room for both kids. I've yet to attach it to a bike to see how that works. Assembly in my opinion is relatively simple and instructions are clear. As long as grandma and the kids are happy, so am I, and she receives a lot of compliments from other parents at the school
customer_reviews.author: HA!

customer_reviews.title: The Kids Love It
customer_reviews.text: This bike trailer has been a blast! Works well, was easy to assemble. The only complaint id have is that there isn't really a great way to store it during the months we don't use it... but That's kind of a toy problem in general I guess. I would say the same thing about our bikes too so it's not a design flaw. Definitely worth buying and fun to use.
customer_reviews.author: Anders

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this trailer so my grandson (3 1/2 yo) can go on bike rides with me. Assembled this in about an hour, was super easy. It folds easily and quick assembly (tires & flag) when ready to use. My grandson loved his first ride. Would like a little more support in the seat for him, but he didn't mind. Only been out once so far, but hoping the rest of our rides go as smoothly and fun as the first.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne Parr

customer_reviews.title: I love this!!!
customer_reviews.text: Totally love this bike trailer/stroller. Tires did come without much air, but a bike pump fixed that right away. The initial set up took a little effort (hand strength for clamps etc), but after a couple of times of set up and take down it becomes very easy. I set mine up and take it down each time due to lack of storage area. I have used it as a stroller and as a bike trailer and both were great. Pushes with ease as a stroller with two kids and pulls great behind a bike with two kids. Also took the two dogs for a ride in it. This is an all around GREAT product. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Steele Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk!
customer_reviews.text: Very very poor quality. I tried to assemble this and while tightening the straps below the seats, my hand was pricked even though nothing is visible. As such, I never put my toddler into this trailer. I also had trouble inflating the tires as the rims are plastic and very bulky, my bicycle pump nozzle can't fit in! If I could give a zero star rating, I would.
customer_reviews.author: Elene Tan

customer_reviews.title: Customer service great! Product good too!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great trailer/stroller. My 4 yr old (44lbs) loves to go bike riding with us around town. Customer service was great too-had a rip in the fabric from shipping. Once I emailed pics to them, a full replacement was shipped in two days-no muss no fuss. Wouldn’t take the wheels off roading. Easy assembly/disassembly. Good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonia

customer_reviews.title: Great for price!
customer_reviews.text: For the price- this is perfect and exactly what we were wanting! We have a chill 8 month old, but even when I went off the edge a couple times with him in it, he didn’t seem phased. I love how there is room in the back for storage, and how you can push it like a stroller! Then we can bring it camping, and don’t have to bring it and our stroller!
customer_reviews.author: Jamanlew

customer_reviews.title: Front flap has no effective closure.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty decent little trailer. Our 2 year old daughter loves it. It's pretty small, but luckily so is she! The only problem is that she easily slides out of the harness and the front flap just sort of clips shut, so she leans out and tries to touch the tires and ground. It's be nicer to have a zippered front so she is at least still contained.
customer_reviews.author: A James

customer_reviews.title: Read the reviews! Wheels are crap!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a couple months. Inflated tires and made sure not to exceed the limit indicated. The tire blew, damaging the plastic rim. No longer usable. After reading the reviews, it appears this is a common problem with this product. The wheels are cheaply made. Trying to save a few bucks is going to end up costing a lot more if I have to buy a new trailer or find wheel replacements for this one. Will update review after discussing with their customer support.
customer_reviews.author: KenO

customer_reviews.title: Love this, but one warning...
customer_reviews.text: Love this trailer! Have only tried it behind a bike, not jogging yet. BUT like some other reviewers, we had a blown tire first trip out. My husband is really mechanical so I don't think it was an error on his part. We replaced the tube and have had one successful trip out so far!
customer_reviews.author: cherieb03

customer_reviews.title: dissapointed in tire quality
customer_reviews.text: I have a 3 and 1.5 year old toddlers. we have used it about 2 times as a stroller. This past weekend, i added air to the tires to at the suggested PSI. we went to a park about 1 mile from the house and back. the Tire had lost all the air when we returned. Sure glad this was not used with my bike as it could have dangerous consequences.
customer_reviews.author: Bernie B

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t last.
customer_reviews.text: The strapping inside of my Bike trailer disintegrated, so I am unable to use it for my new baby. I called the company, wrote an email, and never heard back. It’s a good product in theory, but after you use it for one child it may not last for the second.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Light and very functional
customer_reviews.text: This is the second bike trailer I've had and it's my favorite of the two. It is light yet sturdy, and it has quite a bit of cargo space behind the seat. It comfortably sat my two kids, ages 4 and 5, at the same time. It folds very flat, which is great for transporting and storing when not in use. My only complaints are that the wheels are plastic and the front end of the canopy is very hard to pull down enough to complete the Velcro seal.
customer_reviews.author: JSE

customer_reviews.title: Fun Fun Fun
customer_reviews.text: I actually gave this to my neighbor for his 1 year old grandson and probably in a few months his granddaughter. He assembled it very fast. I don't think that he has tried folding it. The grandson really likes it.
customer_reviews.author: LDM

customer_reviews.title: Fill your tires with air, put on the bike and you’re ready to go!
customer_reviews.text: I definitely recommend this! Great quality, easy to put together, travel with, use as a double stroller without the bike attached and of course it’s great to go biking. Just a heads up for the first use - put air in the back 2 tires that come with it and you’ll be all set for your ride! I did not do that and go a flat within a couple minutes of my first ride
customer_reviews.author: Carlie Rider

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for two small children.
customer_reviews.text: I have a 5 and a 3 year old that I carry in this trailer during weekend rides and they fit perfectly (my 5 year old is on the small side). There's also cargo room in the back and can carry about a small backpack's-worth of items. The wheels can be easily removed and the trailer folds flat. There's also a bright orange flag you can place on the trailer for added attention when riding near busy roads. However, the wheels are plastic and not as durable as a metal wheel. After going over some pretty nasty bumps, my wheels are a bit warped and wobble. They are still operable and my kids have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: CH

customer_reviews.title: Great except for plastic wheels
customer_reviews.text: We bought this when my son was younger and continue to bring it on camping trips. When the kids grow out of it we used it to haul our beach gear and fishing gear. My only complaint is the wheels are plastic and got deformed inflating tire as others are noting in their reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Kev

customer_reviews.title: Light leisure only
customer_reviews.text: Looking to tote your little one around town? On short rides? At really slow speeds? And your kid doesn't wiggle at all? Then this is for you!!!! But otherwise, you may want to look for a trailer with a better seatbelt or harness and seat. This thing really does not have a seat at all, just a sling of fabric with straps that keep them in the trailer, yes, but not really in position. Not supportive, and probably not comfortable, or very safe. It's seems to be a pretty rough ride back there. We used this for a season and then sold it to upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: taco

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: Had the trailer opened up and assembled in about 15min. Took a few extra minutes to figure out how to attach it to my bike, but it went on very easily and now that I know how it works, I can hook it up/disconnect it from my bike in about a minute. It's well put together, and I haven't seen any flaws with it so far. Both my 2 and 4 year old kids can ride in there together, although they are a little cramped. I got it more for the 2 year old anyway. But regardless, they love going with me around the neighborhood.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan A. Weintraub

customer_reviews.title: Bad customer service
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the trailer until the wheel broke off and part of the plastic flew across a parking lot. I was lucky it didnt hurt anybody. Instep customer service was rude and not helpful. They were going to charge me a lot of money to replace it. I feel like it is a product issue and they should have been more helpful. I would not buy from them again!
customer_reviews.author: mtnman

customer_reviews.title: Great bicycle carrier for the kids (or pets)
customer_reviews.text: The carrier is sturdy, was easy to assemble & visually appealing. I bought it as a gift for my niece & she is thrilled with it! The only issue was a broken reflector light in the back but I sent mail to Amazon & feel sure they will replace it but it isn't a big deal. I had reviewed other products online but this one came with the coupler & handle so you could attach it to a bike or use as a jogging stroller without having to purchase any additional components. I recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Marsha G.

customer_reviews.title: Love!!
customer_reviews.text: My 1 1/2 year old loved this! We buu I got 2 couplings to put on each of our bicycles so we can easily detach and attach back and forth between both our bicycles without needing a wrench. The quick connect makes it all so easy!
customer_reviews.author: Stel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the novice biker with kids!
customer_reviews.text: I like this bike trailer. We are novice riders with a 20 month old so we didn't want to spend a few hundred dollars on something that was only going to get used periodically in the summer months being in Indianapolis. There are a few things I would recommend changing, room for the kids' helmets to allow their necks to be straight and a way to shorten or fold the front wheel when using it as a stroller...oh and some more air flow through the sides/back. It's perfect for our use but if you're looking for all the thrills or something you'll use a lot more often...spend the extra $$ on something higher end.
customer_reviews.author: FrequentBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Nice trailer
customer_reviews.text: Great as a trailer. Loaded my 2 yo and 4 yo in and the love to ride. It's okay as a stroller except that the front wheel sticks out to far and you have to be careful not to ram the ankles of the person in front of you. Don't like the braking system (just a strap that you have to loop around the wheels and trailer frame) or the fact that i had to remove my rear mounted kick stand to attach the trailer hardware. Now i have no bike kick stand.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I gave my wife a hard time about spending money on a bike trailer but this one has served us well for 2 beach trips plus rides around the park. The trailer has a lot of storage space behind the seats which we like to use for beach toys, towels, and drinks for long days on the beach. We typically leave the front wheel on the trailer with the stroller handle to quickly convert it to a stroller after we pull the kids to the beach. Overall, this is a very versatile trailer/stroller that I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: c

customer_reviews.title: So many more uses, other than connecting to bikes
customer_reviews.text: We use this like a stroller, so the value is amazing! It's huge, for just the one little, so she has her baby dolls, snacks, etc. in there with her. We also bought an adjustable umbrella to create shade as we live in FL and the sun can be tough without shade. This doesn't have any shade, but that's fine. The price was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Megan G.

customer_reviews.title: Bad wheels
customer_reviews.text: Brought this in the fall after much research. When it arrived one of the seals on the wheel was damaged. The company sent a replacement. Today I pulled the trailer out of winter storage, hooked it up, strapped my child in. We didn't even make it to the end of the block and the plastic on the wheel broke. I used the trailer once.
customer_reviews.author: Allison Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: It's good. However just a little to wide to get through a standard doorway. You need to lift one side and angle. There is no shade, could do with a top section, instead of rolling straight to the front.
customer_reviews.author: victoria

customer_reviews.title: Yes, yes, yes!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this product! Light weight, easy to attach/detach from bike and is an excellent jogging stroller too! The quality of the structure and parts are great and the airflow with the wind shield pulled back is great. Would definitely buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Jenn Kost

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Runs smooth. Compact enough [when folded] that it fits perfectly in my car. Takes a few minutes to assemble when you're ready to roll. My 2 yr old loves it and he looks comfortable. Plenty of "window" for him to see around. He never wants to get off after. When we are not bike, I take him out running on a "stroller mode" and he and I do not have any complains. It's light to move around. The only this I do not like actually is the handle bars you connect. It's too low. At first I thought it might have been the orinetati
customer_reviews.author: RV

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price. I researched more expensive models with more features and higher reviews, and chose this one based on price and reviews. It was a great decision. I was worried that the footwell needed to be stronger (reinforced or made with plastic instead of fabric only) and I have quickly realized that it is unnecessary. My 1 year old sits comfortably in the middle seat with blankets tucked in on either side. He loves to nap while I bike! If you are looking for a great value - buy this trailer.
customer_reviews.author: L. Gibson

customer_reviews.title: LOOOOOOOOOOVE it
customer_reviews.text: I love it! It is so simple to put together and take down, I needed a screwdriver once and a wrench once. It is lightweight but sturdy, I felt in control with it on the back of my bike and my son loved it. He actually loved it the second I opened the box he wanted to sit in it before I put on the wheels or anything. It also easily converts to the stroller and I am so excited to be able to push my son and his friend around. And for the price, it's amazing!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jayme

customer_reviews.title: Cheep wheels and 10mph rating
customer_reviews.text: We were enjoying it untill the rim cracked all the way around the inside. This caused the lip to bow out and tire no longer stays on. I never over filled the tires or overloaded the trailer. Was doing some research and discovered that the trailer is only rated for 10 mph
customer_reviews.author: Alicia H

customer_reviews.title: Its perfect !
customer_reviews.text: We love this ! We just got it today. Easy to set up, very nice quality. My 10 month old loves it! It has an option for side by side seating or you can seat 1 in the middle all with 5 point harness options. You can move the shoulder harnesses too, there is 3 height options ! Rides so well too. We absolutely love this!
customer_reviews.author: KAYLIN

customer_reviews.title: Good stroller
customer_reviews.text: 4 stars. My item arrived with a broken front piece on the bar
customer_reviews.author: AtLgUrl

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, only takes a couple screws. Folds down and tires come off making it easy to store and transport. It’s fairly lightweight. There’s area Begging the seats to store things for the ride. We love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The trailer itself is very nice. The fabric is well made and its relatively ...
customer_reviews.text: The trailer itself is very nice. The fabric is well made and its relatively light. The low rating is for the wheels. As mentioned before, they're cheaply made from plastic and wobble if you're above 10mph. I know that the price is right, but its really worth the extra money to find a different brand (with metal wheels).
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Tires get flat
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for our trip on Sept for my small dachshunds. It looks great as the picture but I just barely open it and inflated the tires and the next day they were flat iv done it a couple times and still getting flat so I'm kinda disappointed that's the only reason I'm giving it 1 star. Other then that looks great
customer_reviews.author: jennifer

customer_reviews.title: You should absolutely get it.
customer_reviews.text: My son loves it. But the only thing is the straps to buckle him in are a little small. So I can’t really buckle him in. But that’s probably because he’s a little bit bigger than most kids his size. My son is 39 pounds, 92 inches long. And he’s only 20 months old. But anyway there’s plenty of room in there for him and few toys.
customer_reviews.author: Jennpher

customer_reviews.title: bad tires do not buy !
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived defective!!! Right tire will not hold air our of the box .... very disappointing I do not reccommend this at all , other reviews clearly state this exact issue you think the company would address this serious problem , I should have listened!! will be returing and never buying any instep product again!
customer_reviews.author: Arnold Rode

customer_reviews.title: Way better than a double stroller
customer_reviews.text: We decided to change to a double bicycle from a double stroller because it folds down so much better and is easier to take places. I love that there is a large space in the back to put stuff, which came in handy on a trip to the amusement/water park nearby and walking adventures to the splash parks around us. I wish we had done this from the beginning.
customer_reviews.author: SWIMNEDAY

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS TRAILER!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this trailer!! I purchased it for our paralyzed pug dog. She loved going places and there is plenty of room for treats. Trailer is very sturdy and well made. It folds fairly flat, buy simply pulling out pins. Walking, running or biking were all fun! I sold ours to a friend after our pup passed away... now; I'm buying another one for our new small dog, whom loves to travel!
customer_reviews.author: HappyDad

customer_reviews.title: Pushing it is so easy, I have never pushed a stroller that glides ...
customer_reviews.text: Pushing it is so easy, I have never pushed a stroller that glides like this. The seats are on the small side and doesn't recline back much. My kids won't sit in it for long periods. Not easy to take down, I can barely reach the handle when pushing it though, I am 6'4.
customer_reviews.author: Cam

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great.
customer_reviews.text: This is a truly amazing trailer for the price. Breaks down really easily, is sturdy and well thought out. It would be a bit big as a jogger but certainly is usable as one in a pinch - or between rides. Also delivered in just one day for us (though we just paid for the usual prime 2 day) in the Bay Area.
customer_reviews.author: Q. McLaughlin

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money !
customer_reviews.text: It arrived just as promised and no damage on the item or packaging. I’ve taken the grandkids for walks pushing it and pulled them behind the bike . They love this thing for the money it’s well worth it . As of right now 5 stars I’ll update this as needed .
customer_reviews.author: Ronniez

customer_reviews.title: So easy to collapse and put in the trunk for rides ...
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a trailer to take my 1 year old out on daily bike rides around the neighborhood and do not regret this purchase for a second! So easy to collapse and put in the trunk for rides around lakes or parks. Likewise, assembles in a matter of minutes (at most) and you're on the road!
customer_reviews.author: A.B.

customer_reviews.title: My Kids love it
customer_reviews.text: The kids love going for a ride now. It is kinda snug for them. I have one son that is 3 and a daughter that is 1.5. They are super quiet when riding just taking in the sites. The trailer is super smooth and I have not noticed it pushing me down the hills either. Making turns are very easy as well. It collapses and stores very quickly. Connect the hitch to the bike is the longest part, once the hitch is installed then the quick disconnect is super easy. They also have additional hitches available to install on other bikes so that you can connect/disconnect the trailer very easily.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Griffis

customer_reviews.title: I should have read the reviews
customer_reviews.text: This item was an impulse buy and a mistake. I should have read the reviews and paid a little more for a better quality product. The wheels are made out of thin plastic and the tires are very cheap. Bottom line is that I don’t feel comfortable carrying my son in this carrier and I’m selling it at our upcoming yard sale.
customer_reviews.author: Jaw Bone

customer_reviews.title: Great for biking and walking
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought a similar bike carriage for our baby a few years ago from Schwinn. It was a single seater and we have another baby now. I’d read reviews and they were hit or miss but decided to take a chance and get this one and see how it went. They are virtually identical but this one is a lot more versatile. The fact that this can also be used as a jogging stroller is a really nice feature as we like to go for walks a lot. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Saaarrraaahhh

customer_reviews.title: Faulty Innertube/Tire
customer_reviews.text: We LOVED this bike carrier and used it for biking and jogging. However, like others have stated, we used it maybe less than 10 times and I assume the innertube on one of the tires popped and will no longer inflate. Now it is totally useless.
customer_reviews.author: Erika Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Didn't meet expectations
customer_reviews.text: At first, I was excited about this. But, this weekend after 1 month of use, one of the snap buttons ripped on the front left just this weekend (a couple of days after the Amazon return window). I also happened to notice that one of wheels isn't true and it wobbles a bit. I'm not sure how long this had been going on, because I had been using it as a bike trailer instead of a stroller. The velcro fasteners are also poorly designed. I think that a zipper would have been much better and probably more durable than a velcro/snap option. Overall, not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I love mine as a trailer and jogger. It has worked great so far. I try to take good care of it because I know its not super high quality, but I think as long as its not abused it will last. It is a little tight for my babes. I appreciate the price.
customer_reviews.author: Laine

customer_reviews.title: Great trailer and great price!
customer_reviews.text: Great! Came real quick to the beach. Great design. You will need a screw driver for the two screws and a wrench if you are going to connect it to your bike. The bottom portion where the kids sit is just padded fabric which is fine. Be sure to hold the bike as the kids are climbing in because a kickstand isn't that sturdy. It also comes with a safety flag. My 2 year old loves it as we can go quickly to the playground or beach.
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: Good trailer-Netting lets dirt in
customer_reviews.text: We love this trailer ... except for the fact that the screen is not fine enough to keep dirt out. Unfortunately on a hot day I can’t put the weather screen down and my kid ends up covered in dirt from it going through the holes of the screen. Finer netting would make this trailer perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Kalie Kurutz

customer_reviews.title: Good product, what you see is what you get.
customer_reviews.text: Works great, I would definitely recommend this for a bike trailer. It works as a stroller too but not as nice as a traditional stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: great product.
customer_reviews.text: great product. my 3 year and 1 year love it much more than their stroller. it's not only a bike cart but fully capable stroller for 2 kids. folds easily, loads into my small coupe's trunk easily. awesome product. will recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Lee

customer_reviews.title: Total piece of crap, even for the price
customer_reviews.text: Straps are worn in under a year, and all snapped and broke a little after a year. Bike and trailer are stored inside garage (protected from sun). Used with only one child under 30 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: RL

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: So far I am not hugely impressed. Granted I only took the kids out in it one time but still. The top cover is held on with velcro and it is stretched so tight that it is really hard to completely shut over the kids. The "seat" is just a hammock with nothing underneath. That didn't seem to bother the kids at all though. It handles nicely overall though. It is easy to push as a stroller and is easy enough to pull once you get going. It is definitely a workout and hard to start and stop frequently with my older child.
customer_reviews.author: JMS

customer_reviews.title: the three wheel version is a fantastic addition for families of 2 kids
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was simple but manufacturing defects affected the overall satisfaction. Due to one button snap being mid-formed, the cover would not snap and didn't sit well over the cabin for the kids. Other than that, the three wheel version is a fantastic addition for families of 2 kids!
customer_reviews.author: Sween

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to convert between the two
customer_reviews.text: I use this thing multiple times a week, sometimes as a jogging stroller, sometimes as a bike trailer. Very easy to convert between the two, so long as you don't mind twisting on knobs to attach the handle/front wheel, etc. I also really like how compact it is when folded up - easy to transport! I have already recommended it to several other people.
customer_reviews.author: BKlass

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: Very nice! Tons of room ! My 1 year old grandson (22) and 9 year old grandson (65) rode in it and it held up ! ( pushing not riding a bike) . It was super easy to put together! You will love it !
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany M.

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: For the price this trailer was the best one I found. I put it together by myself in 25 minutes. Can't review the stroller adapter since I haven't used it. The trailer is a pretty smooth ride. I saw past complaints about snaps. I did have one snap that was bent in such a way on one side that it wouldn't snap together. I just got some pliers and bent it back flat, and it works like a charm. My 10 month old hasn't cried in it once. And my 5 year old always wants to ride in it, too! I wish I could take off the straps when I'm not using them. Other than that, great!
customer_reviews.author: Enzo's Mom

customer_reviews.title: This trailer is the BEST!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this back in 2013 and it has lasted 4 summers so far. This is an amazing little trailer that has held up through two kids. There are times when my 8 year old still has to ride in it and I've attached his bike to the bar in back with straps and it hauls the 8 year old, the 5 year old, bike, and gear. We haven't had any issues with the wheels (we mostly ride on trails and roads). We are about to take it on vacation and I'm glad it can pack down. I highly recommend this trailer. It has been worth every single penny we spent on it.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer H.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to put together. Very easy to steer. Easy to fold up. Very sturdy. I have not pulled it behind a bike yet, love it as a stroller!!
customer_reviews.author: aj

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This bike trailer is exactly what I wanted. We use the trailer for our 12 month old son and he loves to ride in it. The tires allow for a smooth ride, the inside is spacious enough for a couple toys or stuffed animals, or another child. The cover just snaps & velcros to the frame for easy assembly. The cover is bright and highly visible. The attachment is a simple pin locking mechanism. We have not used this as a stroller and do not intend to.
customer_reviews.author: PandemoandMaia

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. My husband had no issues putting it together. Our 14 month old loves riding in it and the storage space behind the seat easily fits the diaper bag and a cooler bag. Only wish that there was some sort of attached sunscreen or shade but we tied a small blanket over the top bars, under the mesh, to keep the sun off her face. Super easy, all metal, attachment to the bike and the stroller option is easy to push. Overall great purchase and we look forward to using it for a long time to come!
customer_reviews.author: surfmommy

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY - Trailer is decent but plastic rims keep popping tubes
customer_reviews.text: One more person that has replaced multiple inner tubes that keep popping. Even with low PSI they just pop. The last one popped just sitting in the garage with low PSI after I replaced the tube. Very sad that I have a trailer I can't use / trust. I don't want to be sitting at the park with a flat (again!) and have to walk home with my 2 boys.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Giffin

customer_reviews.title: My lazy dogs are happy
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. My dogs are too lazy to walk. Now I just plop them in and put on my rollerblades.
customer_reviews.author: happy peeps

customer_reviews.title: Overall quality of the product is very good, easy to Install
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 4 yrs old son. Overall quality of the product is very good, easy to Install, easy to pull by bike as well as push. Customer Care service is good in my experience. I think this product is best suit for below 3 yrs kids as there is not much of legs room. I can't push seat to make room for legs, it is kind of fixed. One of the Tire burst in night within two days of purchase (may be I put a little more air), I connected Customer Care and they sent a pair of tube, which is good.
customer_reviews.author: pritam

customer_reviews.title: Spend a bit more on a trailer that won't break so easily
customer_reviews.text: Wheel rims are molded plastic. I used the trailer moderately with only a 30 lb child in it and after 1 year both rims started to crack. Finally one completely broke while riding which caused the tire to blow. Luckily we weren't in traffic. The wheels aren't replaceable so now I need to buy an entirely new trailer. After reading through more reviews in detail I saw this is a very common problem.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin A Halbert

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works well and my daughters love it. Haven't had any problems with it but it would be nice if the wheels were sturdier or if you could buy spare tires.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: tires flatten too easily
customer_reviews.text: No where in the instructions does it state tire pressure required. first time tire ruptured we are guessing due to over inflating. Plastic wheels don't hold tire in place very well, inter tube bulges out over rim. We have already flatten two tires once due to over inflating second due to the bulging. Called the company and they without questions sent replacement tube however that didn't help with the crying grand children that were expecting a ride.for the money it is fine otherwise but I guess you get what you pay for. If you want a trailer for daily use, I would buy one of the more expensive ones.
customer_reviews.author: Gretchen Mortensen

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable for children vs. Standard stroller
customer_reviews.text: This product has been a lifesaver for a few years now. I have a small in home daycare and this product has provided many children with safe and larger than stroller environment for comfortable outdoor play. The rain cover can be closed in rain and snow....it even blocks the children from the wind and cold on chilly days. Although slightly bulky, I would highly recommend this over a standard stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Slightly uncomfortable, but overall good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've used mine a couple of times now. I have 1.5 year old twin boys. They're OK without helmets. With helmets their heads get caught on the seatbelts. They also push their heads uncomfortably forward. The seat is not well supported in the center which causes the kids to constantly lean into each other. Really uncomfortable on a hot day. Great for short trips, I usually flip the 3rd wheel upside down and bungee it so it doesn't contact the ground or bike while riding. The stroller rolls nicely, works great as long as you aren't going through tight spaces.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

product_meta.title: Instep Quick-N-EZ Double Tow Behind Bike Trailer for Toddlers, Kids, Converts to Stroller, Jogger, 2-in-1 Canopy, Universal Bicycle Coupler, Folding Frame, Multiple Colors
feature_bullets: Take your children along for the ride with the InStep Quick-N-EZ double tow-behind bike trailer carrier.
16-inch pneumatic tires with molded rims provide performance, safety, and timeless style. A five-point harness ensures your riders are protected in both tow and stroller mode.
The folding-frame design and quick-release wheel make for quick and easy assembly, storage, and transport.
Designed to protect your child from the elements, a 2-in-1 canopy features both a bug screen and a weather shield with rear vent window.

This tow-behind child carrier fits most bike styles. The maximum weight limit is 80 pounds (two 40-pound children) with an additional 12 pounds in the rear storage area. Some assembly is required and this trailer comes with a 1 year limited .

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
